title.value: Metrics reloaded: recommendations for image analysis validation
title.justification: The title explicitly reflects the focus of the paper: providing recommendations for image analysis validation metrics.
title.quote: Metrics reloaded: recommendations for image analysis validation

extractions.description: This paper presents a comprehensive framework named Metrics Reloaded, which aids researchers in selecting appropriate validation metrics for image analysis tasks, particularly in the biomedical domain. The framework is designed to address flaws in metric selection that hinder the translation of machine learning techniques into practice. It introduces a novel concept 'problem fingerprint' to guide metric selection and implements an online tool to support metric application. The development involved a large consortium and a Delphi process to ensure consensus and applicability across diverse biomedical use cases.

type.justification: The paper is primarily concerned with the establishment of a framework and guidelines rather than empirical testing or experiments.
type.quote: To overcome this, we created Metrics Reloaded, a comprehensive framework guiding researchers in the problem-aware selection of metrics.

name.justification: The paper addresses issues specifically related to metric validation in biomedical image analysis, which is indicated by repeated references to biomedical applications and use cases.
name.quote: In biomedical image analysis, chosen performance metrics often do not reflect the domain interest, and thus fail to adequately measure scientific progress and hinder translation of ML techniques into practice.

name.justification: The study relates to machine learning as it discusses the application of ML algorithms and their performance assessment in biomedical imaging.
name.quote: Automatic image processing with ML is gaining increasing traction in biological and medical imaging research and practice.

name.justification: The paper focuses on image analysis tasks, highlighting classification, object detection, and segmentation as target tasks for improved metric selection.
name.quote: Metrics Reloaded targets image analysis problems that can be interpreted as classification tasks at image, object or pixel level, namely image-level classification, object detection, semantic segmentation and instance segmentation tasks.
